review_blob: This guy poors a nice auburn color with a complementary tan head.  I tend to find amber ales mediocre at best but this one is a man amongst boys.  It tastes like a red ale only where youd usually say blah, here you say, mmmm.  Malt and carmel lord over this guy, with just enough hops to make sure everyone plays nice.  There are some rich, buttery notes to this that translate into the mouthfeel which I found enjoyable.  I do think there are more reasonably priced alternatives in this category

Tasted this guy next to a stone ruination - very similar on the pour - nice thick white head with a beautiful light copper coloring.  Smells syrupy and yeasty.  Taste is deeper than most IPAs.  It doesnt dance light on your tongue,  its a smooth combination of brown sugar and malt that slides down with ease.  Leaves its mark with a distinct apricot profile on the finish.  A very fine IPA

Tasted this guy next to an ale smith IPA - very similar on the pour - nice thick white head with a beautiful light copper coloring.  Smell like a hop field during harvest time.  This beauty is the dominatrix that will punish your hop fetish.  A malty Bitter citrus flavor gives way to a sweeter orange and grass profile which fades to a floral hop bitterness.  Not too shabby, but be prepared.
Medium maltiness but lacking in the citrus and floral characters of the great IPAs.  Hop bitterness is decent but not all that well balanced with the rest of the beer.
beer_name: Butte Creek Organic India Pale Ale

review_blob: UPDATED: SEP 12, 2006
not the best Pale Ale ive ever had.  A bit sweet with no real outstanding characteristics.
beer_name: Boulder Beer Pass Time Pale Ale

review_blob: A decent IPA,  hoppy, citrusy etc.  Its sweeter than some with less of a hop bite.  I will get this again.

An interesting beer (got as a bonus in a trade with jimbowood).  Didnt taste exactly as one might expect for an imperial IPA, but quite good.  There was a malt heaviness weighing on the floral notes of a traditional I.IPA, giving it an almost candy orange flavor.  Nice dry hoppy finish.
A fairly standard IPA.  Slight citrus, a decent hop profile with some good hop bitterness.  Nothing too good, nothing too bad.
A good IPA... all attributes are standard issue... where it stands out it is a bold hoppiness that isnt too bitter.

A decent IPA thats less heavy on citrus and floral notes than alot of IPAs.  Theres a pretty good battle going on between malt and hops, which is eventually won by the hops  Aroma was good ... kind a deep orange, earthy hopness.
This is a very fine porter.  Theres notes of caramel, dark cherry,  a very slight coffee that is really secondary to the overarching malty sweetness.   Finishes smooth and clean.
A decent british brew.  Malty sweet with little carbonation.  A little bit a caramel may come through if you watch close.
Nice aroma, nice orange color.  Theres a good hop bite to this with a small hint of citrus and a good dose of floral.  Clean finish.  Not a bad IPA

I got a decent hop aroma.  It comes out almost a burnt orage - a bit darker than some IPAs.  Head is nice and the flavor is what youre aiming for in an IPA... a bit of citrus, a lot of hops and a smooth malt undertone.  hop bite on the finish that mellows nicely.  Overall a fine IPA.. and I agree with slimweebs maybe a bit heavier than other good IPAs ALA Sierra neveda but not quite a double either.

Got this as a surprise in a trade with JimboWood - (thanks jimbo!) A sweet beer that is maybe not as complex as something should be when the "imperial" label is slapped on it.  Its drinkable but doesnt really stand out from the pilsner crowd.
A crisp beer that can act as your goto when your at your in a macro situation...
A bit of maltiness that adds a little complexity to the lager style.  A crisp beer that can act as your goto when your at your in a macro situation...

Opened a 2004 bottle with Shigadeyo.  This is one fantastic beer.  Sweet, with hints of cherry, apple and yeast as it slides down down your throat like a belgian dominatrix.  Youll be begging for mercy and for more of this beer after the first sip.  The alcohol is well hidden.   MMMM, is all I have left to say.  If you have a newer bottle, you may want to sit on it for a year or two because I could see where the alcohol could burn a bit early on....

Not since your moms teet have you tasted mothers milk like this.  Smells sweet, slightly like flowers blowing in a citrus breeze.  The the taste is an incredibly well balanced array of malt hops and an orange like sweetness that lingers till the early morn.  Three floyds hit this nail on the head.  Id almost suggest you dont drink it, because it will alter your perception of Imperial IPAs forever.

My Alesmith, My Alesmith, why hast thou forsaken me?!?  Im assuming I didnt love this beer because of its age...its very HOT...  It just seems to be lacking in the smoky malty areas that define a good scotch ale.
Tastes like scotch flavored beer.  Very deep malt flavor with heavy notes of smoke that linger long after the beer is gone.

A decent scotch ale.  Nice copper hue... smells like a tub of malt extract tastes heavily of malt with a bit of a caramel finish.  Not a bad brew but not necessarily the best scotch ale.  Not much in the way of smokiness...

The Cowboy is out of business but I have to get my props in for this beer.  This was the best hefe Ive had, bar none.   The banana / clove was perfect and this beer had a spiciness that was so complemantary that it nearly rendered the beer perfect.  Great body, greath mouth feel.  Its just a shame most people cant appreciate good beer because losing this Gem was a tragedy for Scottsdale.

You might want to call this brewery Turdsy Dog because youre likely to crap your pants in surprise at such a good IS coming out of OH.  Granted its not Speedway or Dark Lord but a very drinkable Imperial.  Pours black and smooth with slight carbonation.  Very deep chocolate flavor with almost a hint of green olive... Its not huge on hops which really lets the roasted malts come shining through.  Thick and slick mouthfeel as it goes down.  Very Good.
beer_name: Thirsty Dog Siberian Night Imperial Stout

review_blob:
Had mine out of a bomber...From Rivers Bend.
The head on this baby was incedible - it was a thick tan ice cream looking head that lasts forever...Smell is something like an orange tree growing in a Pine forest.
Taste is grapefruit and pine with a hop kick that will knock the taste right back out of your mouth
Its a pretty good double - definitely a must for hop heads.

Good dark color one would expect for an oatmeal stout 

very smooth stout with silky texture.  The roasted malts of a stout and slight bitter coffee give way to a vanilla-caramel and maybe nutty taste
A good Oatmeal Stout.  Ill get this one again.
beer_name: Anderson Valley Barney Flats Oatmeal Stout

review_blob:
Murky deep copper

smells a bit of pear and alcohol

hoppy bitterness fights for time with a pretty decent alcohol bite

apple maybe cranberryesque slight note of caramel.

fairly heavy mouthfeel with just the right amount of carbonation for an old ale.

would probably fair well with a year in the cellar.

I did enjoy it

Had this on tap at The Works... amber / copper color with a loose cream colored head.  Very carbonated.  Tastes a bit malty and slightly sweet caramel with a slight hoppy, green finish.  Not too bad for the style.
beer_name: Flying Dog Old Scratch Amber Lager

review_blob: All the sudden Im seeing a bunch of 2001 Rouge I.S. on the scene so I couldnt resist.  Pours inky black with a small but dense head of dark tan color.  Smells like and I.S.  Coffee, roasty and almost salty... and the taste is very bitter coffee and deep roasted, almost burnt malts.  I get some chocolate with slight notes of dark cherry.  Not bad maybe a bit too much bitter coffee for my liking. Alcohol is barely noticeable Mouthfeel is fairly thick with low carbonation.  A pretty good beer for 5 yrs old...
Unfortuantely I can only rate this at .5  This is what beer tastes like when it dies and goes to hell....

This is an interesting beer - people seem to either be pleasantly surprised or like me they were disappointed.  With such a long name and the promise of bourbon barrell aging I was enchanted into picking one of these guy up at the locale store.  Its fairly dark with very little head - theres a lot of stouty stuff going on (slight roast, a bit of coffee and maybe a hint of chocolate) with a bit of bourbon taste floating around.  Mouth feel was incredibly thin and I agree with a previous reviewer - this is probably a really strong sweet stout masquerading as an Imperial.  Interesting but I probably wont get another.
beer_name: Bluegrass Jeffersons Reserve Bourbon Barrel Stout

review_blob: A bit bland, even for an american macro.  Id say it dies on your tongue but it was dead long before then.

Pours out a clouy amber with a decent white head.  Smacks of American Wheat.  Im often disappointed by the style but this one was quite satisfying.  Citrusy, a bit of orange and lemon.  Its light on its feet, crisp and quite smooth.  I think its got a bit bigger body than most American wheats with just a hint of malt.  Overall, A good summer beer.

A quintessential American Pale Ale.  Pours out a light amber with a big fizz and a bubbly head.  The flavor is classic APA citrusy, hoppy with hints of malt floting around.  Theres some floral and a bit of pine on the back end.  It defintely has a good hop bite which complements the crispness of the beer.  A very refreshing experience that never gets old.

What can I say besides for kiss my Bass, I love this stuff!  Of course there are better beers out there but Bass is a quality example of what an English Ale should be -  Medium copper color, slight white head, low in carbonation and dominated by sweet malt.  A fine old friend who always delivers

Not the best beer youve ever had, but lets be honest... youre not looking at this site to get the latest review of Bud... Its not worth describing because if you havent had an American MacroBrew, you are not a qualified beer drinker. This guys probably my favorite macro - good for chugging in mass quantities - I always stuff a couple ice cold 24oz in my backpack for hiking trips.  Speedway Stout wouldnt be quite the same around the campfire!

Looks and feels like any other oatmeal stout youve had ... nothing bad or good to write home about there.  Taste is quite thought and leaves most of the rest in its oatmeal dust.  Its dry but with a biscuty sweetness - not sweet just good.  A little chocolate and maybe hints of a subtle fruit like apple.  Utlimately a smooth and very drinkable oatmeal stout

Smells of malt, grapefruit and a bit of pear.  Pours a deep copper color with nice bubbly but thick light brown head.  Taste is malty and again a citrusy hoppyness that is quite unique.  Im a reborn fan and will drink this often.

color was dark but more along the lines of deep red then an inky black that one expects with an imperial stout.  tastes a bit of chocolate with a smokey sweetness.  It was a bit thin and  too carbonated for the style of beer.
beer_name: Left Hand Wake Up Dead Imperial Stout
